Compiling MiniINI without STL support

By default, MiniINI includes STL and contains methods using STL classes. If you need absolute minimalism, e.g. for embedded systems, STL might be too big.

MiniINI has an option to disable STL support. With GCC, you can compile it without STL support using: 

make no-stl

With other compilers, you will need to define macro MINIINI_NO_STL at compilation.

You also have to define macro MINIINI_NO_STL before inclusion of the MiniINI header, e.g.: 

#define MINIINI_NO_STL
#include <miniini.h>
